post.title: Studies say that if you're not born with the talent, don't waste your time trying

author.bio_html:
â€¢é»’çª“â€¢

Follow me at discussions.app, Votal and communities.win.ðŸ’œ

body:
But trying to justify why you're shit isn't going to help. 
The value of a human being isn't necessary measurable in the way we can ascertain how a machine is valuable.
You have to have faith in yourself and other people. You have to try to understand that you don't need to understand your worth or how you are useful in this world.
You don't have a complete encyclopedic knowledge of all the things a person is capable of doing.
It might be nice to say that you have talent X or you're good at such and such, but that's mostly just a social tool.
It's more valuable to be willing to try. Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities.
You're not as awful and hopeless as you think. You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.
But you probably mostly post all of this stuff so that people will give you pep talks. I used to do that. What if people got tired of it and just ignored you completely? People do get tired of it. 
Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.
body_html: But trying to justify why you're shit isn't going to help. The value of a human being isn't necessary measurable in the way we can ascertain how a machine is valuable. You have to have faith in yourself and other people. You have to try to understand that you don't need to understand your worth or how you are useful in this world. You don't have a complete encyclopedic knowledge of all the things a person is capable of doing. It might be nice to say that you have talent X or you're good at such and such, but that's mostly just a social tool. It's more valuable to be willing to try. Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities. You're not as awful and hopeless as you think. You're just always focusing on people who do better than you. But you probably mostly post all of this stuff so that people will give you pep talks. I used to do that. What if people got tired of it and just ignored you completely? People do get tired of it. Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

post.title: Studies say that if you're not born with the talent, don't waste your time trying

author.bio:

author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
> Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities. 

Not really, most people who are talented in one area are gifted all around. There are different strengths and weaknesses but there's also just general intelligence. For us mortals that's hard to understand, but I think for them they just have a flow or instinct to do these things naturally. That's probably why they don't believe us when we say we're trying and not getting the results, because they've never experienced that; for them, they usually get insane results as soon as they start something even if they don't try all that much. That's frustrating too.

> You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.

> Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

I know, but when nearly everyone you know *is* one of those types who is special and ultra gifted, and you're the only person you know who isn't, it's extremely hard to remember that.
body_html:
Not having a specific talent prevents you from resting on your laurels and it leaves you open to more possibilities.

Not really, most people who are talented in one area are gifted all around. There are different strengths and weaknesses but there's also just general intelligence. For us mortals that's hard to understand, but I think for them they just have a flow or instinct to do these things naturally. That's probably why they don't believe us when we say we're trying and not getting the results, because they've never experienced that; for them, they usually get insane results as soon as they start something even if they don't try all that much. That's frustrating too.

You're just always focusing on people who do better than you.

Birds, flowers and trees don't need to be talented or "special" to be valuable and beautiful. Neither do you.

I know, but when nearly everyone you know is one of those types who is special and ultra gifted, and you're the only person you know who isn't, it's extremely hard to remember that.

post.title: Studies say that if you're not born with the talent, don't waste your time trying

author.bio_html:
â€¢é»’çª“â€¢

Follow me at discussions.app, Votal and communities.win.ðŸ’œ

body:
You don't know what they're like behind the scenes and you don't know how much previous experience you have. You're also building a personal myth of yourself as The Failure. 
Instead of looking at everyone else and beating yourself up over your failure. Focus on what you can do and transform your self-pity into genuine humbleness.
